objectives: Discuss medical tests and results using clear WH and Y/N structures
Confirm understanding of next steps with repeat-back and neutral returns
Use time-first framing for scheduling follow-up appointments

vocab.def: Common exam terms; point to location (blood = arm, x-ray = chest).
Outcome signs; use clear facial affect for each.
Action verbs for tests; pair with time markers.
Confirm next steps; ensure patient repeats provider lines.
Provider â†” patient with clear neutral returns.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Test Vocabulary + NMM
sections.body: Practice: **BLOOD TEST ARM**, **X-RAY CHEST**, **GIVE-SAMPLE URINE**. Add **NORMAL / NOT-NORMAL** with affect: neutral face for normal, tight brows for not-normal.

microCheck.q: How do you show an abnormal result?

callouts.title: Neutral Returns
callouts.body: Always pause in neutral before repeating or switching roles.

microCheck.q: What shows the patient understood the provider?

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **15â€“20s**: provider explains one test result + follow-up, patient repeats back. Must include **time-first**, **NORMAL/NOT-NORMAL**, **one WH or Y/N question**, and **neutral return**.
sections.teacherNote: Caption which test type you used (blood, x-ray, sample) and the follow-up schedule.
